issues.description: The problem statement describes the GET /persons endpoint as returning a Set of all persons, but both the template and the solution implement this endpoint (and the service method it delegates to) to return a List<Person>. This mismatch between the textual specification and the provided code can confuse students about which collection type to use and may lead them to attempt to change method signatures or return types unnecessarily.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the specification and code consistent. Either update the problem statement to say that GET /persons returns a List<Person> (recommended, since the template and tests already use List), or change the template and solution signatures to use Set<Person> consistently (e.g., change service.getAll() to return Set<Person> and adjust repository/calls accordingly). Updating the problem statement to 'List' is the minimal change and avoids structural edits to the template/tests.

issues.description: The problem statement explicitly says the endpoint GET /persons returns a "Set" of all persons, while both the template and the solution implementations define the endpoint to return a List<Person> (ResponseEntity<List<Person>>). This mismatch in the collection type naming (Set vs List) refers to the same conceptual entity — the collection of persons returned by the API — and can cause confusion for students when mapping the textual requirements to the provided code (e.g., looking for methods or types returning Set, or expecting set-specific semantics).
issues.suggested_fix: Make the collection type consistent across artifacts. Either update the problem statement to describe the endpoint as returning a List (or more generally a collection/array) of persons, e.g. change wording to "returns a list (collection) of all persons", or change the implementation signatures to return a Set<Person> (and adjust tests/serialization accordingly). The least disruptive fix is to correct the problem statement to say "List (or collection)" to match the existing template and solution code.
